extension_description.message: IP Locator & more for your favorite video chats: Chatruletka, ome.tv, Minichat & Omegle. Chatruletka Extension.

desc.message: This is a browser extension that extends the functionality of Chatruletka (aka ome.tv), as well as some other online video chats.

screen_remote.message: Make a screenshot from the interlocutor's camera

screen_local.message: Make a screenshot from your camera

main.message:
Important:
This extension is a hobby project and is not affiliated with '$1' in any way.

mainHint.message:
$3

Did you know?
$2

mainDiscord.message:
Important:
The extension community is hosted on Discord.

On our Discord server you can subscribe to project updates, report a bug, suggest a feature, get technical help and discuss the extension with the developer and other users.

apiStatus0.message: IP geolocation API doesn't work at all, check if vpn/adblock is blocking the connection: try disabling adblock, adding ip-api.com to whitelist or even using another browser. If that didn't work for you, please ask the developer for help via discord.

apiStatusRegular.message: Please report the issue to discord.

apiStatus429.message: Too many requests, please try again later.

github.message: More useful information: github.

hotkeys.message: <dd>left arrow - skip</dd><dd>shift+left arrow - skip+ban</dd><dd>up arrow - stop</dd><dd>down arrow - report</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>left arrow - cancel report</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>right arrow - send report</dd>

tooltipWatermark.message: hides the watermark in the upper left corner of the interlocutor's camera

tooltipBanner.message: hides the banner with the current instance logo, current overall online, and mobile applications

tooltipFour.message: automatically skip interlocutors that are taking more than 4 seconds to connect to

tooltipAutoskipWrongCountry.message: automatically skip if you are looking for someone from X country but chatruletka found you someone from Y country

tooltipForcedRecognition.message: continues to determine the gender of the interlocutor even if the gender skipping is disabled

tooltipSkipMales.message: tries to determine the gender of the interlocutor and skips if faceapi is 90 percent sure that the gender of the interlocutor is male

tooltipSkipFemales.message: tries to determine the gender of the interlocutor and skips if faceapi is 90 percent sure that the gender of the interlocutor is female

tooltipAutoskip.message: automatically adds the interlocutor's IP to the blacklist, if he/she was automatically skipped by gender

tooltipDonotbanmobile.message: Prohibits adding mobile IP addresses to the blacklist. They are temporary and can be used by many users. Please disable if IP API is not working.

tooltipSkipSound.message: plays sound when added to the blacklist and when the banned interlocutor skips

tooltipEnableHotkeys.message: Enable cool arrows hotkeys. This does not affect the extension hotkeys that are configured in the browser settings. If you accidentally pressed a key, hold for 5 seconds before releasing so that the extension can understand that there is no need to process.

tooltipSentry.message: allows the extension to collect information about its errors and send them to sentry.io

reloadRequired.message: PAGE RELOAD IS REQUIRED BECAUSE YOU HAVE CHANGED SOME IMPORTANT SETTINGS

tooltipStreamerMode.message: Enables a special set of functions for streamers. If you disable it, everything below will not work.

tooltipStreamerHotkeys.message: enable a special set of hotkeys for streamers

streamerHotkeysText.message: <dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>right arrow - blur</dd><dd style='margin-inline-start: 40px!important;'>m - mute remote video</dd>

tooltipStreamerPip.message: Allows you to open the interlocutor's camera in Picture-in-Picture mode. It can be used to monitor the interlocutor's camera while it is blurred. PiP is a separate window that does not affect the captured browser window (OBS).

tooltipBlurOnStart.message: every new conversation will start blurred

tooltipBlurPreviews.message: blur the preview in case your interlocutor uses a custom client that sends NSFW previews

tooltipPreviewBlurStrength.message: value for the preview blur filter

tooltipBlurCoverLocal.message: enable this if you also want to blur/cover your local video (mirror)

tooltipCoverOverBlur.message: enable this if you want cover instead of blur

tooltipCoverOverPreview.message: enable this if you want to activate cover when found (preview)

tooltipCoverOverNoise.message: enable this if you want to activate cover when searching

tooltipCoverOverStop.message: enable this if you want to activate cover when stopped

promptCoverSrc.message: Enter a direct link to the picture/gif (4:3) for use as the cover.

tooltipDoNotReflect.message: turn it on if you are uncomfortable seeing yourself reflected

doNotCover.message: do not crop the interlocutor's camera:

tooltipDoNotCover.message: enable this if you are uncomfortable looking at a cropped picture from mobile devices and want to see your interlocutor, and not the edge of his head

tooltipHideCamera.message: enable it to hide your camera to make the conversation more natural

tooltipCustomApiBehaviour.message: turn on if you want to configure which providers to use for your geolocation requests. the providers are arranged in order of use, if first one fails, the extension will try the next one and so on until the last one

tooltipAllowVeApi.message: turn this on if you want to use the videochat extension's server to process geolocation requests. we use the ip-api.com's paid service, so the data will not be different, but our server is used by default because it helps avoid issues with http restrictions and has twice the limit per minute than ip-api.com. the server's source code can be found on github.

tooltipAllowIpApi.message: turn this on if you want to use the service 'ip-api.com' to process geolocation requests. we have used this service as the only one for many years: it is very fast and reliable, gives acceptable data quality and is free for non-commercial use. cons: the free version only works via http (some users may have technical issues) and has a limit of 45 requests per minute. to avoid this issues we started using our own server with a paid subscription to the same service by default.

tooltipApiLocalisation.message: Turn this on to request localized data. Available languages: English, German, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Japanese, Chinese, Russian.

tooltipIpApiPreferredLang.message: Select your preferred language for geolocation data. If there is no translation, data will be in English.

tooltipHideMobile.message: Turn this on so that the city and region will be hidden if the interlocutor has mobile internet. Almost always these data are not correct.

tooltipShowCT.message: Turn this on so that the city and region will be displayed in the 'CT' section if the interlocutor has mobile internet.

tooltipShowMoreInfo.message: Enable this to display additional information about the IP address. Mobile - mobile (cellular) connection. Hosting -  proxy, VPN or Tor exit address. Hosting - hosting, colocated or data center.

tooltipShowISP.message: Enable this to show ISP (Internet Service Provider) data if available.

tooltipTargetSkipMobile.message: Mobile network is known for inaccurate geolocation. Should extension skip mobile network users when you are targeting for a specific place?

tooltipTargetCity.message: if interlocutor's city is not in provided list (City1, City2, City3) => skip.

promptTargetCity.message: enter city/list of cities you want to find

tooltipTargetRegion.message: if interlocutor's region is not in provided list (Region1, Region2, Region3) => skip.

promptTargetRegion.message: enter region/list of regions you want to find

tooltipTargetSound.message: plays a sound when the target city/region is found

tooltipTorrentsEnable.message: displays a button to search for torrents that your interlocutor probably downloaded (only for those IPs that are not recognized as mobile/tor/proxy)

tooltipTorrentsInfo.message: shows a modal explaining what the 'iknowwhatyoudownload' button means (it reappears after page reloads)

tooltipExpand.message: expands the height of the 'Settings' tab to make it easier to customize

tooltipIgnoreSiteStyles.message: prevents the font size of the control panel elements from changing due to the non-embed style of the video chat site itself

tooltipShowHints.message: if enabled, will show a random 'Did you know?' message every time you open a video chat

tooltipshowHintsMoreOften.message: if enabled, hints will show every time you open a video chat. if disabled, there is only a 33% chance of appearing

YKWYDHtml.message:
iknowwhatyoudownload is a service that collects data from BitTorrent networks and associates pirate IP addresses with torrent distributions, earning money by working with copyright holders, advertisers and the police.

Simply put, you can find out what your interlocutor could have downloaded from torrents recently.

This is a great opportunity to discuss with the interlocutor his tastes in games, music, cinema and pornography!

You should not take this information as one hundred percent (one IP address could be used by several people + the service does not cover all pirate resources), but since the button is not displayed for mobile networks / known VPNs, the chances of success are very high!

Pay attention to the number of torrents: if there are 3-10, then it can be a real person, if there are 30+ of them, probably too many people used the IP address.

If you are a streamer, keep in mind that on the page that opens, the IP addresses of the interlocutor and YOURS ALSO will be displayed!
Make sure that you are using VPN / OBS is configured to capture exactly the Chatruletka window.

After clicking an 'OK' button, a window separate from Chatruletka will open, and if you click the button again, the old service tabs in this window will close.
You can display that new window on a second monitor/half screen.

minimalismExplainHosting.message: — IP address belongs to the data center.

switchModeText.message: Please choose the mode that suits you best.

updateNeedReloadText.message:
Your browser has reloaded the extension, most likely it has downloaded a new version of it!
Please reload the page to restore the work.

welcomeCuriousCheckText.message: I want to learn more and customize the extension:

welcomeCuriousCheckTitle.message: If enabled, the extension will show you more useful (from the developer's point of view) information in the welcome screens. This option is disabled by default because people don't like to read.

welcomeHistoryScanNotFound.message: We did not find supported video chats in your history / they are already in Favorites.

welcomeSwalPermissionContent.message:
The extension doesn't have enough permissions right now.

The extension requested access to the sites of supported video chats, you should have a dialog box.

You may not give permission, but then the extension will not work on these sites ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

welcomeSwalTimerText.message: The menu will open in sec.

popupSiteEnabled.message: The extension is active for the site. Click to disable it.

popupSiteDisabled.message: The extension is disabled for the site. Click to enable it.

popupSiteMissingPermission.message: Click to give the extension access to the site.

popupSettingAllowSetLastIcon.message: Change the extension icon to the icon of the last video chat.

popupSettingAllowSetBadgeText.message: Set the text 'ext' below/above the extension icon.

popupSettingLegacyIcon.message: Use legacy icon (disables the dynamic icon and badge)

popupSettingSentry.message: Allow extension to share with sentry.io anonymized information about errors that have occurred.

popupSettingAllowShowChangelog.message: Open changelog when you open an videochat and there was an update in the extension (does not show in minimalist mode).

popupSettingMissingPermissionCheck.message: Allow an extension to request access from you to a supported video chat that you have not yet granted access to.

popupMissingPermissionSwalText.message:
You tried to open $1, which is supported by the Videochat Extension, but you have not yet granted your permission to operate on this site.



Extension supports $2 chat websites already and this optional permission system is the only way that works without disabling the extension on every update.



If you want to disable the extension in a specific video chat, you just need to click on the checkmark in the list to turn it off/on.

popupMissingPermissionSwalDenyButtonText.message: Click to disable this check (not recommended)

tooltipShowChangelogToggle.message: If enabled, when you go to the video chat site and the extension has been updated, a window will open with the changes to let you know what has changed (not shown in minimalist/limited mode).

freecmExtensionHeaderTitle.message: Click to read about the features of the extension on this site.

freecmSettingHideBotsTooltip.message: The extension will hide the bot's video feed if enabled.

freecmSettingMuteTooltip.message: The extension will hide the bot's audio feed if enabled.

freecmCountriesListTitle.message: Message from $1: You have been identified as $2. You will come across the following countries: $3.

supportDescOmegle.message: Limited support. Features: IP Locator & Dark Mode.

supportDescFreecm.message: Limited support. Features: bot recognition & interface tweaks.
